events.message: The policyholder reported an auto accident involving their vehicle on Main Street with visible damage to the front bumper and airbags deployed.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords indicating vehicle collision and damages.
An agent was promptly assigned to the auto accident claim to ensure thorough handling and timely communication with the policyholder.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer of active processing starting immediately.
The agent requested additional documents including photos of the damaged vehicle, police accident report, and repair estimates to proceed.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed pictures and the official police collision report for claim verification.
The claims department began investigating the details of the auto accident to verify damages and liability based on submitted evidence.
The investigation concluded successfully, confirming the extent of damages and coverage eligibility for the policyholder’s vehicle repair.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the customer for review and approval.
The customer provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and timely communication.
Following customer acceptance, the claim was officially approved by the insurance company for disbursement of funds.
Payment corresponding to the approved settlement was issued to the policyholder’s designated bank account promptly.
The auto accident claim was closed after successful payment and confirmation that all repair work was completed satisfactorily.
The claim file was archived for record-keeping and future reference in compliance with company procedures and data retention policies.
